title: Certificate in Aviation, Hospitality & Travel Management

description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to the aviation, hospitality, and travel sectors, preparing students for a successful career in customer service, airport operations, airline management, travel agencies, and hospitality services. It combines practical knowledge with soft skills training, grooming, and communication skills.

title: Basic Certificate in Hotel Management
subtitle: Foundational Training for Entry-Level Roles in the Hotel and Hospitality Industry
description: This course is designed to provide students with fundamental knowledge and practical skills in hotel operations. It covers essential areas such as front office, housekeeping, food & beverage services, and customer interaction. Ideal for beginners seeking entry-level roles or further studies in hospitality.
certification: Basic Certificate in Hotel Management from the training institute (some may offer NSDC or Tourism & Hospitality Skill Council affiliation)
instructor: Experienced hospitality trainers, hotel professionals, and industry experts with practical knowledge

title: Certificate Course in Hotel Operations
subtitle: Comprehensive Training in Hotel Departments: Front Office, Housekeeping, F&B, and Guest Services
description: This course equips students with the practical and theoretical knowledge required to work in various departments of a hotel, including front office, housekeeping, food and beverage services, and guest relations. It is ideal for beginners seeking a professional entry into the hospitality industry.
certification: Certificate in Hotel Operations from the institute Smart gyan Training Institute
highlights: Hotel Department Overview (Front Office, Housekeeping, F&B)
instructor: Trained hospitality professionals, ex-hotel managers, certified hospitality trainers

title: Basic Hotel Front Office & Guest Service Training
subtitle: Entry-Level Training for Front Office Operations & Guest Relations in the Hotel Industry
description: This short-term certificate course is designed to train students in the basics of hotel front office operations, including handling guest check-ins and check-outs, reservations, concierge services, and professional guest interaction. It builds confidence, communication, grooming, and hospitality etiquette needed for customer-facing roles in hotels.
certification: Certificate in Hotel Front Office & Guest Services
syllabus: Duties of Receptionist & Front Desk Officer
instructor: Hospitality trainers, ex-hotel staff (Front Office Managers, Guest Relations Executives), soft skills coaches

title: Certificate in Front Office Operations
subtitle: Professional Training for Hotel Front Desk & Reception Services
description: This course provides in-depth training in front office operations including guest handling, reservations, check-in/check-out, billing, and customer service. It prepares students for roles like receptionist, front desk executive, and guest service associate in hotels, resorts, and other hospitality setups.
instructor: Trainers with hospitality background — typically ex-hotel staff (Front Office Managers, Guest Relation Officers), grooming coaches, communication experts

title: Food & Beverage Service Training
subtitle: Comprehensive Training in F&B Service, Restaurant Operations & Customer Service Skills
description: This course is designed to provide practical knowledge and skills for working in food and beverage service roles within hotels, restaurants, cafes, and bars. It includes training in food and drink preparation, serving, guest interaction, restaurant etiquette, and managing customer expectations.
syllabus: Service Standards & Techniques (Silver Service, A la Carte, etc.)
instructor: Experienced chefs, restaurant managers, F&B trainers, and certified hospitality professionals
